description:
'''Raúl Alejandro Escajadillo Peña''' (born September 29, 1969), known by his stage name, '''Aleks Syntek''', is a Mexican singer and songwriter. He has earned nine nominations for the [[Latin Grammy]] Awards, a Grammy nomination, five nominations for the MTV Latin Awards, and is the winner of three Latin ''Billboard'' awards. He has also received an [[Ariel award]] from the Cinametografia Mexican Academy for Best Film Music.

As a performer and singer Syntek has released 10 albums receiving Gold and Platinum disc awards for high sales. He has earned special awards such as "The Honor Composer Achievement Award" presented by the [[Univision]] Network by actor Edward James Olmos and also "The Music Legacy Award" presented by the North American Society of Composers SESAC. Syntek also starred and pioneered the hit show [[The Voice (franchise)|The Voice]] in México.
